title: Establishing a White House Office for Special Peace Missions

enrichment.summary: This executive order creates a new Office for Special Peace Missions within the White House, led by a Special Envoy appointed by the President, to coordinate efforts aimed at ending conflicts around the world. The office will work closely with the State and Defense departments and other agencies to support peace initiatives abroad.
potential_concerns: The coordination role of the new office may create bureaucratic overlap or conflict with existing State and Defense department peace and diplomacy efforts.
Without clear authority or funding provisions, the Office for Special Peace Missions might lack effectiveness or remain symbolic.
Political considerations could influence appointments and actions of the Special Envoy, potentially undermining nonpartisan peace efforts.
The focus on ending conflicts abroad may lead to criticism about U.S. engagement priorities or overreach in foreign affairs.
Unclear metrics for success and accountability could hamper evaluation of the office's impact or waste resources.
